content: more information, see 7.5.8, “z/OS XL C/C++ considerations” on page 321. Out-of-order execution Out-of-order (OOO) execution yields significant performance benefits for compute-intensive applications by reordering instruction execution, which allows later (newer) instructions to be run ahead of a stalled instruction, and reordering storage accesses and parallel storage accesses. OOO maintains good performance growth for traditional applications. The supported operating systems are listed in Table 7-3 on page 253 and Table 7-4 on page 254. For more information, see “3.4.3, “Out-of-Order execution” on page 81. 7 Hardware-based Vector-extension facility 2. 278 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide z/OS DFSORT exploitation of IBM Integrated Accelerator for Z Sort The Integrated Accelerator for Z Sort is an on chip hardware feature that is available on IBM z15 and newer servers. It is driven by the SORT LISTS (SORTL) instruction. z/OS DFSORT takes advantage of Z Sort, and provides users with
